alert.note: Alert for Benton; Henry; Houston; Humphreys; Stewart (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 26 at 9:23PM CST until March 06 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Tennessee... Tennessee River at Johnsonville For the Tennessee River...including Pickwick Dam, Savannah, Saltillo, Perryville, Johnsonville...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY, MARCH 06... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Tennessee River at Johnsonville. * WHEN...Until Sunday, March 06. * IMPACTS...At 361.5 feet, Low-lying portions of Old Johnsonville Road near the Battle of Johnsonville Park begin to flood, and water approaches some of the parking areas and campgrounds at Mason`s Boat Dock near Waverly. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM CST Saturday the stage was 360.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 360.7 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall to 360.6 feet and begin rising again tomorrow morning. It will rise to 360.9 feet early Monday afternoon. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Action stage is 360.0 feet. - Flood stage is 361.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
